intro: Philammos eriolobus, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The flowers emit a sweet fragrance, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
